parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake caliper can cause the brakes to stick, leading to overheating, and potentially causing a loss of control or accident.
symptoms: Abnormal odor of burning rubber from the brakes
brake caliper locked
metal-to-metal sound on brakes
brake pads worn down to metal
scraping on the outboard side of the rotor.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Cracked rotors can cause the brakes to fail, leading to a loss of control or accident.
symptoms: Rotors cracked on the outboard surface
brake pads worn down to metal
scraping on the outboard side of the rotor.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake hydraulic system can cause the brakes to stick, leading to overheating, and potentially causing a loss of control or accident.
symptoms: Abnormal odor of burning rubber from the brakes
brake caliper locked
metal-to-metal sound on brakes
brake pads worn down to metal
scraping on the outboard side of the rotor.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A windshield leak can cause water to enter the vehicle, obstructing the driver's vision, especially during rainy conditions, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Water runs down the inside of the windshield
blurring and obstructing vision
water accumulation on the dashboard or interior surfaces.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Sudden failure of the windshield wipers can cause poor visibility, especially during rainy or snowy conditions, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Windshield wipers quit working without warning
poor visibility
fuse blows
circuit board failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the tail light housing assembly can cause the tail lights, turn signals, and brake lights to malfunction, reducing visibility and increasing the risk of accidents, especially at night or in low-light conditions.
symptoms: The tail lights
turn signals
or brake lights do not function
the bulb falls out of the housing
the housing assembly is damaged or deformed
the lights are dim or flickering.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The design of the 1157 tail light bulb can generate excessive heat, causing the bulb to fall out of the housing and resulting in malfunctioning tail lights, turn signals, and brake lights, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The tail lights
turn signals
or brake lights do not function
the bulb falls out of the housing
the housing assembly is damaged or deformed
the lights are dim or flickering.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The lack of an access panel for the water heater can make it difficult or impossible to perform routine maintenance, repairs, and replacements, potentially leading to safety hazards, water damage, and system failures.
symptoms: Difficulty accessing the water heater for maintenance
repairs
or replacements
requiring removal of the entire water heater unit
increased risk of water damage
corrosion
or electrical shock.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The manufacturer's failure to follow installation instructions can lead to safety hazards, system failures, and increased maintenance costs, potentially causing inconvenience, financial loss, and safety risks to vehicle owners.
symptoms: Inadequate installation of components
failure to follow manufacturer's instructions
disregard for safety protocols
increased risk of system failures
and potential safety hazards.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Axle Weight Distribution and Length Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The improper weight distribution and length of the rear axle can cause the front end of the motorhome to bounce excessively when going over bumps, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: The front end of the motorhome bounces or oscillates when driving over bumps
uneven road surfaces
or potholes; the vehicle may feel unstable or unresponsive; the rear axle may be overloaded
causing premature wear on tires and suspension components.
